reference.title: TLB organization
reference.shortdesc: The TLB is a cache of recently executed page translations within the MMU. The Cortexâ€‘A76 core implements a two-level TLB structure. The TLB stores all page sizes and is responsible for breaking these down in to smaller pages when required for the data or instruction L1 TLB.

link.desc: The instruction L1 TLB is implemented as a 48-entry fully associative structure. This TLB caches entries at the 4KB, 16KB, 64KB, 2MB, and 32MB granularity of VA to PA mapping only.
The data L1 TLB is a 48-entry fully associative TLB that is used by load and store operations. The cache entries have 4KB, 16KB, 64KB, 2MB, and 512MB granularity of VA to PA mappings only.
The L2 TLB structure is shared by instruction and data. It handles misses from the instruction and data L1 TLBs.
